item.title: Kingdom Hearts Missing-Link delayed to unannounced date
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/kingdom-hearts-missing-link-delayed-to-unannounced-date

  • Smartphone

No longer due out in 2024.

Square Enix has delayed GPS-based action RPG Kingdom Hearts Missing-Link from its previously planned 2024 release window to an unannounced date.

“While preparing for the launch of Kingdom Hearts Missing-Link, we have made the difficult decision to delay the release,” reads a tweet from the Kingdom Hearts Missing-Link official Twitter account. “We sincerely apologize to all players who have been looking forward to the release. We appreciate your patience. Please look forward to further information.”

Kingdom Hearts Missing-Link will be available for iOS and Android.

item.title: Edia teases El Viento, Earnest Evans, and Anett Futatabi collection
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2024/11/edia-teases-el-viento-earnest-evans-and-anett-futatabi-collection

The next Telenet revival project.

Edia has launched a teaser website for a new Telenet revival project, which features artwork of the box art’s from Wolf Team titles El Viento, Earnest Evans, and Anett Futatabi.

El Viento originally launched for Genesis on September 20, 1991 in Japan, followed by November 1991 in North America. Earnest Evans launched for Mega-CD on December 20, 1999, followed by Genesis in March 1992 in North America. Anett Futatabi launched for Mega-CD on March 30, 1993 in Japan. All three games are part of a trilogy.

Follow Edia’s “Telenet Revival” project on Twitter @TelenetRevive.
